name: Drum Beat 002 (FX 005 v008)
description: I've been obsessed with iteration. More than that, I've been fixated on taking a single idea, and then applying as many permutations as I can to it. It is interesting to see how much variety can originate from a single source. This sample, as well as this pack in general is a testament to that. You have a simple drum beat, and then, I apply various effects then I iterate and continue ad nauseam. For those who may care about the naming convention: each type of effect is labelled as FX###, and then each variation of parameters within that same effect is labelled by a following v###. Furthermore, if I decide to get ambitious I may iterated the same exact effect with the same parameters again (and again...), I indicate the number of iterations in the name of the track as well. And when I get super ambitious I may chain together effects, and then I indicate the "infra-effect" with an additional v### to indicate that I'm applying different effects to a single instance of a particular effect. Anyway, enough of the monotonous stuff. I hope you enjoy this stuff, I hope you can use it in your own work and that perhaps it sparks something in your mind about the power of iteration, change, and the unity that lies under the diverse manifestation of sound. All I ask is that if you do use any of this in your work at all, to cite me as the origin of the samples, you can cite me, Hewn.Marrow by linking https://freesound.org/people/Hewn.Marrow/. Secondarily, the audio samples may not be used in stock material. But please feel free to use it in your own creations. And if you do, please feel free to drop a line and share what you've made. I love hearing what people do with sounds in general. Thank you.

name: Drum Beat 001 (FX 002 v009)
description: I generated a simple beat in FL Studio 21 using FPC (a drumkit that comes with FL Studio). I used the Funk HQ drum pack samples. The beat is played at 160 BPM and I have presented to you the clean (unedited version) and then I have used Audacity to add effects. Each effect has multiple tweaked versions and I labelled these tracks accordingly. name: Remix of a Remix - Cut Up Drums (Sample from Timbre Sampling Strange Horizon) 030
description: Each of these tracks uses a remix by Timbre (https://freesound.org/people/Timbre/) of a track by StrangeHorizon (https://freesound.org/people/strangehorizon/). The Remix: https://freesound.org/people/Timbre/sounds/692943/ The Original: https://freesound.org/people/strangehorizon/sounds/692918/ I cut these up in FL Studio using Slicex, I applied a compressor called Maximus (using the NY Compression setting) and then added a Live Drum Room Reverb setting in the reverb effect called Luxeverb. Creative Commons 0 so, you know, enjoy and do with it what you will. Cheers, Hew

name: Drum Beat 001 (FX 004 v002)
description: I generated a simple beat in FL Studio 21 using FPC (a drumkit that comes with FL Studio). I used the Funk HQ drum pack samples. The beat is played at 160 BPM and I have presented to you the clean (unedited version) and then I have used Audacity to add effects. Each effect has multiple tweaked versions and I labelled these tracks accordingly. As with all the tracks, feel free to use them, manipulate them, do whatever you wish to them for any projects you may have. I just ask that you provide credit and attribution by providing a link and citing me, Hewn.Marrow as the original creator of the sample. For attribution purposes, use the following link: https://freesound.org/people/Hewn.Marrow/ Thank you and enjoy.

name: Remix of a Remix - Cut Up Drums (Sample from Timbre Sampling Strange Horizon) 009

It is interesting to see how much variety can originate from a single source. This sample, as well as this pack in general is a testament to that. You have a simple drum beat, and then, I apply various effects then I iterate and continue ad nauseam. For those who may care about the naming convention: each type of effect is labelled as FX###, and then each variation of parameters within that same effect is labelled by a following v###. Furthermore, if I decide to get ambitious I may iterated the same exact effect with the same parameters again (and again...), I indicate the number of iterations in the name of the track as well. And when I get super ambitious I may chain together effects, and then I indicate the "infra-effect" with an additional v### to indicate that I'm applying different effects to a single instance of a particular effect. Anyway, enough of the monotonous stuff. I hope you enjoy this stuff, I hope you can use it in your own work and that perhaps it sparks something in your mind about the power of iteration, change, and the unity that lies under the diverse manifestation of sound. All I ask is that if you do use any of this in your work at all, to cite me as the origin of the samples, you can cite me, Hewn.Marrow by linking https://freesound.org/people/Hewn.Marrow/. Secondarily, the audio samples may not be used in stock material. But please feel free to use it in your own creations. And if you do, please feel free to drop a line and share what you've made. I love hearing what people do with sounds in general. Thank you.

name: Drum Beat 001 (FX 005 v028)
description: I generated a simple beat in FL Studio 21 using FPC (a drumkit that comes with FL Studio). I used the Funk HQ drum pack samples. The beat is played at 160 BPM and I have presented to you the clean (unedited version) and then I have used Audacity to add effects. Each effect has multiple tweaked versions and I labelled these tracks accordingly. As with all the tracks, feel free to use them, manipulate them, do whatever you wish to them for any projects you may have. I just ask that you provide credit and attribution by providing a link and citing me, Hewn.Marrow as the original creator of the sample. For attribution purposes, use the following link: https://freesound.org/people/Hewn.Marrow/ Thank you and enjoy.

name: Remix of a Remix - Cut Up Drums (Sample from Timbre Sampling Strange Horizon) 028

Creative Commons 0 so, you know, enjoy and do with it what you will. Cheers, Hew

name: Drum Beat 002 (FX 006 v004)
description: I've been obsessed with iteration. More than that, I've been fixated on taking a single idea, and then applying as many permutations as I can to it. It is interesting to see how much variety can originate from a single source. This sample, as well as this pack in general is a testament to that. You have a simple drum beat, and then, I apply various effects then I iterate and continue ad nauseam. For those who may care about the naming convention: each type of effect is labelled as FX###, and then each variation of parameters within that same effect is labelled by a following v###. Furthermore, if I decide to get ambitious I may iterated the same exact effect with the same parameters again (and again...), I indicate the number of iterations in the name of the track as well. And when I get super ambitious I may chain together effects, and then I indicate the "infra-effect" with an additional v### to indicate that I'm applying different effects to a single instance of a particular effect. Anyway, enough of the monotonous stuff. I hope you enjoy this stuff, I hope you can use it in your own work and that perhaps it sparks something in your mind about the power of iteration, change, and the unity that lies under the diverse manifestation of sound. All I ask is that if you do use any of this in your work at all, to cite me as the origin of the samples, you can cite me, Hewn.Marrow by linking https://freesound.org/people/Hewn.Marrow/. Secondarily, the audio samples may not be used in stock material. But please feel free to use it in your own creations. And if you do, please feel free to drop a line and share what you've made. I love hearing what people do with sounds in general. Thank you.

name: Remix of a Remix - Cut Up Drums (Sample from Timbre Sampling Strange Horizon) 005b
description: Each of these tracks uses a remix by Timbre (https://freesound.org/people/Timbre/) of a track by StrangeHorizon (https://freesound.org/people/strangehorizon/). The Remix: https://freesound.org/people/Timbre/sounds/692943/ The Original: https://freesound.org/people/strangehorizon/sounds/692918/ I cut these up in FL Studio using Slicex, I applied a compressor called Maximus (using the NY Compression setting) and then added a Live Drum Room Reverb setting in the reverb effect called Luxeverb. Creative Commons 0 so, you know, enjoy and do with it what you will. Cheers, Hew

name: Remix of a Remix - Cut Up Drums (Sample from Timbre Sampling Strange Horizon) 008
description: Each of these tracks uses a remix by Timbre (https://freesound.org/people/Timbre/) of a track by StrangeHorizon (https://freesound.org/people/strangehorizon/). The Remix: https://freesound.org/people/Timbre/sounds/692943/ The Original: https://freesound.org/people/strangehorizon/sounds/692918/ I cut these up in FL Studio using Slicex, I applied a compressor called Maximus (using the NY Compression setting) and then added a Live Drum Room Reverb setting in the reverb effect called Luxeverb. Creative Commons 0 so, you know, enjoy and do with it what you will. Cheers, Hew

name: Drum Beat 001 (FX 005 v011)
description: I generated a simple beat in FL Studio 21 using FPC (a drumkit that comes with FL Studio). I used the Funk HQ drum pack samples. The beat is played at 160 BPM and I have presented to you the clean (unedited version) and then I have used Audacity to add effects. Each effect has multiple tweaked versions and I labelled these tracks accordingly. As with all the tracks, feel free to use them, manipulate them, do whatever you wish to them for any projects you may have. I just ask that you provide credit and attribution by providing a link and citing me, Hewn.Marrow as the original creator of the sample. For attribution purposes, use the following link: https://freesound.org/people/Hewn.Marrow/ Thank you and enjoy.

name: Remix of a Remix - Cut Up Drums (Sample from Timbre Sampling Strange Horizon) 011
description: Each of these tracks uses a remix by Timbre (https://freesound.org/people/Timbre/) of a track by StrangeHorizon (https://freesound.org/people/strangehorizon/). Creative Commons 0 so, you know, enjoy and do with it what you will. Cheers, Hew

name: Remix of a Remix - Cut Up Drums (Sample from Timbre Sampling Strange Horizon) 000
description: Each of these tracks uses a remix by Timbre (https://freesound.org/people/Timbre/) of a track by StrangeHorizon (https://freesound.org/people/strangehorizon/). The Remix: https://freesound.org/people/Timbre/sounds/692943/ The Original: https://freesound.org/people/strangehorizon/sounds/692918/ I cut these up in FL Studio using Slicex, I applied a compressor called Maximus (using the NY Compression setting) and then added a Live Drum Room Reverb setting in the reverb effect called Luxeverb. Creative Commons 0 so, you know, enjoy and do with it what you will. Cheers, Hew

name: Remix of a Remix - Cut Up Drums (Sample from Timbre Sampling Strange Horizon) 002
description: Each of these tracks uses a remix by Timbre (https://freesound.org/people/Timbre/) of a track by StrangeHorizon (https://freesound.org/people/strangehorizon/). The Remix: https://freesound.org/people/Timbre/sounds/692943/ The Original: https://freesound.org/people/strangehorizon/sounds/692918/ I cut these up in FL Studio using Slicex, I applied a compressor called Maximus (using the NY Compression setting) and then added a Live Drum Room Reverb setting in the reverb effect called Luxeverb. Creative Commons 0 so, you know, enjoy and do with it what you will. Cheers, Hew

name: Drum Beat 001 (FX 003 v009)
description: I generated a simple beat in FL Studio 21 using FPC (a drumkit that comes with FL Studio). I used the Funk HQ drum pack samples. The beat is played at 160 BPM and I have presented to you the clean (unedited version) and then I have used Audacity to add effects. Each effect has multiple tweaked versions and I labelled these tracks accordingly. As with all the tracks, feel free to use them, manipulate them, do whatever you wish to them for any projects you may have. I just ask that you provide credit and attribution by providing a link and citing me, Hewn.Marrow as the original creator of the sample. For attribution purposes, use the following link: https://freesound.org/people/Hewn.Marrow/ Thank you and enjoy.

name: We are the world - drums
description:
I made a drum recording of We are the world, and this is the drum track for it. Tama drums with a Gretsch maple snare using an extra head laying on the top head, for that 80's fat snare. Lots of reverb... 
There is a tambourine track and handclap track aswell, synced.

name: Drum Beat 002 (FX 005 v009 _ v004)
description: I've been obsessed with iteration. More than that, I've been fixated on taking a single idea, and then applying as many permutations as I can to it. It is interesting to see how much variety can originate from a single source. This sample, as well as this pack in general is a testament to that. You have a simple drum beat, and then, I apply various effects then I iterate and continue ad nauseam. For those who may care about the naming convention: each type of effect is labelled as FX###, and then each variation of parameters within that same effect is labelled by a following v###. Furthermore, if I decide to get ambitious I may iterated the same exact effect with the same parameters again (and again...), I indicate the number of iterations in the name of the track as well. And when I get super ambitious I may chain together effects, and then I indicate the "infra-effect" with an additional v### to indicate that I'm applying different effects to a single instance of a particular effect. Anyway, enough of the monotonous stuff. I hope you enjoy this stuff, I hope you can use it in your own work and that perhaps it sparks something in your mind about the power of iteration, change, and the unity that lies under the diverse manifestation of sound. All I ask is that if you do use any of this in your work at all, to cite me as the origin of the samples, you can cite me, Hewn.Marrow by linking https://freesound.org/people/Hewn.Marrow/. Secondarily, the audio samples may not be used in stock material. But please feel free to use it in your own creations. And if you do, please feel free to drop a line and share what you've made. I love hearing what people do with sounds in general. Thank you.

description: Each of these tracks uses a remix by Timbre (https://freesound.org/people/Timbre/) of a track by StrangeHorizon (https://freesound.org/people/strangehorizon/). The Remix: https://freesound.org/people/Timbre/sounds/692943/ The Original: https://freesound.org/people/strangehorizon/sounds/692918/ I cut these up in FL Studio using Slicex, I applied a compressor called Maximus (using the NY Compression setting) and then added a Live Drum Room Reverb setting in the reverb effect called Luxeverb. name: PSynth with Drums.OGG
description: Drums were made from my own midi files on Magix VST Drum Engine on one track and VST Vita 2 on the other. After mixing down I experimented with the equalizer and chorus, then added ERH's http://www.freesound.org/people/ERH/sounds/47658/. I'm absolutely crazy about that. I slowed it down to 80 bpm to sync better with the drums. After adding the synth loop it seemed to give the repeating bell-tones a higher pitch each time for a spacey sound.

description: A basic, 4/4, syncopated, rock-style beat with simple, electronic drum sounds; gradually added to, modulated and mutilated over six versions (A-F), to evolve into something a bit darker and more glitchy. 2 bars / 8 beats. Dry with no reverb.

name: Repeated Drum Beat 002 (FX 011 v042)
description: I've been obsessed with iteration. More than that, I've been fixated on taking a single idea, and then applying as many permutations as I can to it. It is interesting to see how much variety can originate from a single source. This sample, as well as this pack in general is a testament to that. You have a simple drum beat, and then, I apply various effects then I iterate and continue ad nauseam. For those who may care about the naming convention: each type of effect is labelled as FX###, and then each variation of parameters within that same effect is labelled by a following v###. Furthermore, if I decide to get ambitious I may iterated the same exact effect with the same parameters again (and again...), I indicate the number of iterations in the name of the track as well. And when I get super ambitious I may chain together effects, and then I indicate the "infra-effect" with an additional v### to indicate that I'm applying different effects to a single instance of a particular effect. Anyway, enough of the monotonous stuff. I hope you enjoy this stuff, I hope you can use it in your own work and that perhaps it sparks something in your mind about the power of iteration, change, and the unity that lies under the diverse manifestation of sound. All I ask is that if you do use any of this in your work at all, to cite me as the origin of the samples, you can cite me, Hewn.Marrow by linking https://freesound.org/people/Hewn.Marrow/. Secondarily, the audio samples may not be used in stock material. But please feel free to use it in your own creations. And if you do, please feel free to drop a line and share what you've made. I love hearing what people do with sounds in general. Thank you.
